column5: My brothers and I are planning a week of fishing in Ontario this June. Anyone have any suggestions on good spots ..could be fly-in, but it doesn't need to be. We are not fishing experts by any stretch , so we do not know where the best places to go are. We would like to catch Bass, and Walleye . Any suggestions within 4 hours of Sault Ste Marie? Thanks,
Welcome on plkazoo.   Maybe you could try out TJ's new site. He's doing a beta test on it here. www.ontariooutfittersnetwork.com/
That's a big area, you'll have lots to choose from. Don't know it that well myself, but hopefully that outfitter list will help you narrow it down.  Mike

I went to Pine Portage Lodge (Kaby Lake) back in Aug. 2004. We caught a lot of walleye & pike. Even my father-in-law caught a lot & he's not a fisherman. Not many trophy fish (though they are there) but you will catch a lot. They don't have any bass but do have whitefish & perch. The food at the lodge is great & the people very friendly. Our group ran the lodge out of beer in less than 3 days.  Here's their link: http://www.fishthefinest.com/

I've been to a few places that fit that criteria:  Five Mile Lake Lodge (drive in) Hawk Air (fly in)  I've got quite a bit of info, so PM me if you'd like to chat sometime.  I can give you a call some night, share some info!  dk
Thanks Nipissing, that is a cool website that TJ has. Should help us  alot.
